item.title: Storm water drain blocked School Rd, 9th September
item.description:
Storm drain blocked underground on school road. Ground water has been running down the street for months. Confirmed as not sewer or water pipe. Recently opened a storm run off drain on property as water was not clearing. Cleaned out drain to edge of property. In recent rains silt and small stones (flood debris) has flowed back up the pipe. This indicates the storm drain on the road is blocked with this debris and the reason ground water is on the surface of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62C, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate give way signage at junction, 9th September
item.description:
The junction of School Road and Lyefield Road East (by number 38 School Road and School Road Flats). Currently there are only dotted lines on the road and a two way sign (by the playgroup). Lots of cars do not stop at this junction, paying no attention to the fact that it is a junction and either turn left into Lyefield Road East or carry on down School Road, often a great speed. This is worse at the moment, due to the diversion and road works on London Road, with higher volume of traffic in Charlton Kings Village. Also being so close to a school, playgroup and part of School Road having no pavement, this is incredibly dangerous and an accident waiting to happen. This junction needs clearer signage with a both a Stop and a Giveway sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
